svg.content: <mxfile userAgent="Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.11; rv:61.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/61.0" version="9.0.6" editor="www.draw.io" type="github"><diagram id="26bf4ef1-ba10-35ce-f7a6-efd4c3da6605" name="Page-1"></diagram></mxfile>

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Fira Code; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 283px; max-width: 577px; width: 576.571px; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.div:
library("tidyverse"); library("simplerspec")
# List of Bruker OPUS files from Bruker NIR or mid-IR spectrometer
lf <- dir("data/spectra/soil-mir-examples", full.names = TRUE)
# Read spectra and metadata from OPUS files into a list in R
spc_list <- read_opus_univ(fnames = lf, extract = c("spc"))
## Spectral data processing pipe ===============================================
spc_tbl <- spc_list %>%
# Convert nested list into tibble
gather_spc() %>%
# Standardize spectra to equal x unit intervals, 2cm^{-1} resolution
resample_spc(wn_lower = 500, wn_upper = 3996, wn_interval = 2) %>%
# Calculate mean spectra by `sample_id` column
average_spc(by = "sample_id") %>%
# Savitzky-Golay 1st derivative, window size of 21 points (2cm^{-1} * 21)
preprocess_spc(select = "sg_1_w21")

metadata from single
OPUS binary files

div.div:
print(spc_tbl)
> spc_tbl
# A tibble: 6 x 11
unique_id file_id sample_id spc wavenumbers metadata spc_rs wavenumbers_rs <chr> <chr> <chr> <list> <list> <list> <list> <list>
1 sample-01… sample-… sample-01 <data… <dbl [1,71… <tibble… <data… <dbl [1,749]>
2 sample-01… sample-… sample-01 <data… <dbl [1,71… <tibble… <data… <dbl [1,749]>
3 sample-01… sample-… sample-01 <data… <dbl [1,71… <tibble… <data… <dbl [1,749]>
4 sample-02… sample-… sample-02 <data… <dbl [1,71… <tibble… <data… <dbl [1,749]>
5 sample-02… sample-… sample-02 <data… <dbl [1,71… <tibble… <data… <dbl [1,749]>
6 sample-02… sample-… sample-02 <data… <dbl [1,71… <tibble… <data… <dbl [1,749]>
# ... with 3 more variables: spc_mean <list>, spc_pre <list>, xvalues_pre <list>

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 11px; font-family: Fira Code; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 351px; max-width: 508px; width: 507.571px; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.div:
# List names are file names and extensions
> names(spc_list)[1] "sample-01.0" "sample-01.1" "sample-01.2" "sample-02.0" "sample-02.1"
[6] "sample-02.2"
# Each measurement data sub-list contains
> names(spc_list[[1]])
[1] "metadata" "spc" "spc_nocomp"
[4] "sc_sm" "sc_rf" "ig_sm"
[7] "ig_rf" "wavenumbers" "wavenumbers_sc_sm"
[10] "wavenumbers_sc_rf"
> spc_list[[1]]$metadata$unique_id
[1] "sample-01.0_2015-11-06 14:34:10"
# Each raw spectrum is a single row data.table
> str(spc_list[[1]]$spc)
Classes ‘data.table’ and 'data.frame': 1 obs. of 1716 variables:
$ 3997.4: num 0.112
$ 3995.4: num 0.111
...
# X unit values are not only represented as column names ("character" type),
# but also as a numeric vector
> str(spc_list[[1]]$wavenumbers)
num [1:1716] 3997 3995 3993 3991 3989 ...
